title: Uncontacted Indigenous Groups Under Threat | 10 News
description: They’re some of the most isolated people in the world – uncontacted indigenous tribes living separate from the rest of the planet. But now these groups are under increasing threat, with tens of thousands of people’s lives at risk from logging, criminal gangs and influencers. 10’s Late News explains. title: Trump Signs Critical Minerals Deal With Japan Amid US-China Summit Rivalry | 10 News
description: With summit season in full swing, deals are being done at a rapid pace - as the United States and China look to outdo each other on the world stage.  Donald Trump has today signed a critical minerals deal with Japan - in a similar move to the one he struck with Anthony Albanese last week. title: US President Trump Warns Putin Over Nuclear-Powered Missile Test | 10 News
description: The US President has scolded his Russian counterpart, saying Vladimir Putin’s test of a nuclear-powered cruise missile was “not appropriate”.  Donald Trump also claimed that an American nuclear-armed submarine is positioned just off Russian shores, ready to strike if required. title: 76-Year-Old Brighton East Grandmother Fights Off Armed Intruders In Home Invasion | 10 News
description: A Brighton East grandmother has fought off two armed intruders who broke into her home and demanded she hand over her car keys.  76-year-old Pat woke to find the pair in her living room, but served up a few stern words, determined not to become yet another aggravated burglary victim. title: Australia Anti-Drone Laser, Suspected Meteorite Hits Car, King Heckled Over Prince Andrew | 10 News+
description: Australian defence company Electro Optics Systems has developed a groundbreaking new laser weapon called Apollo, which can shoot down drones on the battlefield with a beam of light. It’s now in high demand around the globe, with the Netherlands being the first country to purchase the high-tech system.  Dr Andrew Melville Smith was driving his Tesla along South Australia’s Port Augusta Highway when his windscreen shattered, spraying glass everywhere. The heat radiating from his windscreen has led experts to suspect the rock that hit his car was a meteorite. The South Australian Museum is now inspecting the damage and combing for clues of cosmic origin.  King Charles has been heckled over his brother Prince Andrew, with the protester shouting questions about Andrew’s links to Jeffrey Epstein as the monarch greeted fans outside a cathedral in north-west England. It comes as reports indicate Andrew has agreed to leave the 30-bedroom Royal Lodge where he stays for a peppercorn rent. title: Prince Andrew's Ultimatum To King Charles | 10 News+

title: Queensland High School Apologises After Teaching Wrong Topic for Year 12 History Exam | 10 News
description: One of Queensland’s top high schools has apologised for teaching the wrong topic for a Year 12 exam.  Instead of covering Julius Caesar for the Ancient History external exam, students were taught about Augustus.  To make matters worse, families were only notified of the error yesterday and the exam is on tomorrow! title: Global Demand Surges For New Australian-Made Anti-Drone Laser Weapon | 10 News+
description: Australian defence company Electro Optics Systems has developed a groundbreaking new laser weapon called Apollo, which can shoot down drones on the battlefield with a beam of light.   It’s now in high demand around the globe, with the Netherlands being the first country to purchase the high-tech system.   The company says other NATO member states, as well as Middle Eastern and East Asian countries are interested in buying the anti-drone weapon too. title: Social Media Companies Face Senate Grilling Ahead Of Youth Ban | 10 News+
description: The owners of Facebook, Snapchat and TikTok have testified at a Senate inquiry ahead of the looming social media ban for users under the age of 16.   The tech giants have fought the ban from the start but insist they will comply once it takes effect in December.   Nationals Senator Ross Cadell has also made a bombshell claim, accusing TikTok of intimidating and bullying his office. title: Jamaica Braces For Category 5 Hurricane Melissa To Make Landfall | 10 News
description: Hurricane Melissa is hours away from making a direct hit on Jamaica. Mandatory evacuations have been put in place in the capital, Kingston. Jamaica's Prime Minister is already pleading for help, warning no infrastructure in the region can withstand a Category Five hurricane. title: Woman Charged Over Cutting Gas Supply At Two Sydney Hospitals | 10 News
description: A woman has been charged, accused of shutting off the gas and water supply at two hospitals in Sydney's south, in what is being labelled deliberate sabotage. 10 News reporter Sarah Navin has the details.
